page.title: 05Housing in Sanquhar
page.content: The majority of houses in Sanquhar are owned by Nithsdale District Council and the Scottish Special Housing Association, to whom the tenants pay a weekly rent. Nearly all the council houses have been built since the war, and recently some of them have been extensively modernised, many more houses will be improved in the future. Many of these houses are brick-built with a pebble-dashed exterior, although some still have a metal coating. There are however quite a few privately-owned houses, and these are to be found mainly in the older parts of the town, and in an estate built within the last 15 years. These houses are mainly stone-built - some being detached and others terraced. The most recent housing development has been the construction of sheltered housing for the elderly citizens of Sanquhar.
